current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To allow States to waive regulations promulgated under the Clean Air Act relating to electric
			 generating units under certain circumstances.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the
			 Environmental Protection Agency

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a State may permanently waive any regulation relating
			 to electric generating units promulgated by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
if the Governor of the State certifies that the electric generating
			 units are necessary for reasons of power reliability and affordability.

header.#text: Waiver of certain regulations promulgated under the Clean Air Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1988 IS: To allow States to waive regulations promulgated under the Clean Air Act relating to electric generating units under certain circumstances.
